['Wingspan', 'Breast', 'Legs', 'Neck', 'Quarters', 'Thighs', 'Flanks', 'Backbone', 'Giblets (includes heart, gizzard, and liver)', "Pulpits (small portion near the back of a roasted bird's cavity)", 'Trotters (bird feet)', 'Wattle (the fleshy hanging skin under the chin or throat of a turkey or other poultry)', 'Crowns (head, though not a part of the tail portion specifically)', 'Feathers (not actual food but related to bird anatomy and roasting process)', 'Cotelette (a small serving cut from a roasted chicken or poultry)', 'Saplings (small twigs that might be in the vicinity of where turkeys are roasted, not part of the bird itself)', 'Tail Fan (the plumage found at the tail end of certain birds like peacocks; while not typically consumed, it is associated with poultry anatomy and display during preparation)', "Crop (a pouch in a bird's digestive system used to store food before digestion; not part of the roasted meat but related to poultry biology)", 'Shank (the lower leg portion, though technically closer to the legs than the tail portion)', 'Skin (includes any skin-based parts or preparations from a bird like skin and fat for basting, not specific to the tail portion itself).']
